item.title: Stalker 2 Update 1.5 Brings Huge A-Life Changes, New Threats, and More
item.content:encoded:
GSC Game World has released Stalker 2 Update 1.5, which brings yet more improvements to the game's much-talked-about A-Life system, as well as new threats to face and more.

Following on from May's Update 1.4, Update 1.5's main feature is a big boost to the A-Life AI system, which, I think it's fair to say, was released in a fairly incomplete state when the game launched in November.

Per the official patch notes, the A-Life system now means "life in the Zone is now simulated for all characters, not just those in the player's view". This means characters will continue to pursue their goals and live their lives away from what you're seeing, and there are other A-Life changes intended to make the game's AI more immersive as well.

As well as the new A-Life system, you can also look forward to a new hazard in the form of the Water Electric Tornado, and as the name suggests, you're not going to have a good time if you encounter it.

Of course, the new update also brings a ton of bug fixes and balance tweaks with it, so you might want to head back into the Zone if you've been having trouble with glitches. There's obviously no guarantee your particular issue (or "anomaly", hem hem) will have been fixed, but it's worth a go, eh?

If you're unfamiliar with Stalker 2, it's the long-awaited sequel to 2007's Stalker: Shadow of Chornobyl (which was recently renamed to reflect the Ukrainian spelling of the city upon the release of the remastered version).

Like the original, the game will have you exploring the Chornobyl Exclusion Zone in search of artifacts, and you'll meet a full cast of characters, who have now been even further enhanced by the A-Life system.

You can check out Stalker 2 right now on PC and Xbox Series X|S. No mention of a PS5 version has been made yet, but given the friendliness with which Xbox has been approaching PlayStation in recent months, I wouldn't be surprised if a release is on the cards for the future.

item.title: Senua's Saga: Hellblade II PS5 Release Date and New Enhancements Revealed
item.content:encoded:
Team Ninja and Xbox have announced the PS5 release date for Senua's Saga: Hellblade II, as well as the new enhancements current owners on Xbox and PC can expect.

Per a post on Xbox Wire, the followup to 2017's Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice will arrive on PS5 on August 12th. This won't be the first time the franchise has appeared on PlayStation, of course; Senua's Sacrifice got itself a PS4 release, after all.

Still, the game's release on PS5 marks an increasingly friendly approach to PlayStation on Xbox's part. Many of the studio's games are making their way to PlayStation now, including upcoming titles like The Outer Worlds 2 and Gears of War: Reloaded.

In addition to the PS5 release, Xbox has also detailed a number of enhancements coming to the game for Xbox and PC owners, as well as those playing on Game Pass.

Those include a new Performance Mode, which will allow you to play at 60fps on PS5 and Xbox Series X (but not S, unfortunately). The PC version will also include a new Very High graphics preset, allowing you to push more powerful rigs to their limit.

Additionally, Xbox and Team Ninja say that when the enhanced version of Senua's Saga launches, it'll be Steam Deck Verified, so you'll be able to enjoy it on your handheld PC as well.

A new Dark Rot mode, which makes its return from the first game, will also be added to the sequel. Every time you fail, the Dark Rot will advance, and when it reaches Senua's head, you'll fail your run and all of your progress will be lost.

If you pick up the Deluxe Edition of Hellblade II on PS5, you'll also get a version of Senua's Sacrifice enhanced for the PS5, so if you haven't played that game yet, now's your chance.

Senua's Saga: Hellblade II is, believe it or not, the sequel to 2017's Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice. It once again follows Senua, who's on a quest to rescue her countrymen from the Northmen.

You can pick the game up right now on PC and Xbox Series X|S, and it's coming to PS5 on August 12th.
